means: 发明，创造( invent的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: They hadn't invented sequencers back in those days, had they?
sentence.Network_cn: 那时他们还没有发明出测序仪，是吧？

sentence.Network_en: He is said to have invented the sport of celebrity-watching.
sentence.Network_cn: 据说是他发明了观赏名人这项活动。

sentence.Network_en: He invented the first electric clock.
sentence.Network_cn: 他发明了第一个电动机械钟。

entry.def: If you invent something such as a machine or process, you are the first person to think of it or make it.

example.ex: He invented the first electric clock...
example.tran: 他发明了第一个电动机械钟。

example.ex: Writing had not been invented as yet.
example.tran: 书写体系当时还没有创造出来。

entry.def: If you invent a story or excuse, you try to make other people believe that it is true when in fact it is not.

example.ex: I stood still, trying to invent a plausible excuse.
example.tran: 我站着不动,试图编个说得过去的借口。

means.word_mean: 1. formed or conceived by the imagination;

auth_sentence.content: The system is archaic and was invented by accident.
auth_sentence.res_content: The system is archaic and was invented by accident.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The system is archaic and was invented by accident.

auth_sentence.content: It is the time for which vodka was invented.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is the time for which vodka was invented.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is the time for which vodka was invented.

auth_sentence.content: They invented the seatbelt, airbag and child seat.
auth_sentence.res_content: They invented the seatbelt, airbag and child seat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They invented the seatbelt, airbag and child seat.

Sentence.sentence: Decades ago, Kodak anticipated that digital photography would overtake film — and in fact, Kodak invented the first digital camera in 1975 — but in a fateful decision, the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditional film business.
He invented lots of functional gadgets.
Writing was only invented 5,500 years ago.
It was invented by a group of language experts in the year of 1887.
